> -----Original Message-----
> From: Frank Burough [mailto:fwburough@...]
> Sent: 19 March 2003 15:36
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Problem with testing EJBs with Junit
>
>
> Hi--
>
> I am having difficulty accessing EJBs from Junit. I searched
> the archives and
> found nothing that seemed to directly address my problem.
>
> I have implemented a trivial EJB that just uppercases a
> string. When I run a
> client to access this bean, all works well. However, when I
> use the same
> logic from within JUnit, I get a class cast exception when calling
> PortableRemoteObject.narrow. Any thoughts or insights on this
> would be
> welcome. My client application runs standalone, it is not
> web-based or I
> would use cactus for testing.
>
> Any suggestions or comments would be greatly appreciated!
>
>
> Here is the relevant (I think) code:
>
> Properties properties = new Properties();
>
> properties.put(Context.INITIAL_CONTEXT_FACTORY,"org.jnp.interf
> aces.NamingContextFactory");
> properties.put(Context.PROVIDER_URL, "localhost:1099");
>
> try {
> // get initial context
> InitialContext jndiContext = new InitialContext(properties);
> Object ref = jndiContext.lookup("StringProcessor");
>
> StringProcessorHome shome =
> (StringProcessorHome) PortableRemoteObject.narrow(ref,
> StringProcessorHome.class);
> StringProcessor sp = shome.create();
> String input = "This Is a Test";
> System.out.println ("Uppercase of '" + input + "' is " +
> sp.toUpperCase(input));
> } catch (Exception e) {
>
